meanings.definition: Able to be depicted or portrayed.
meanings.sent1: The colorful painting was easily representable on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The detailed map was a good example of a representable illustration.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking animal in the story was quite representable.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a representable rainbow of feelings.
meanings.sent5: The concept of friendship was made representable through their actions.

meanings.definition: Capable of being shown or illustrated.
meanings.sent1: The experiment results were clearly representable in the graph.
meanings.sent2: The diagram was a representable way to explain the process.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to open the door was surprisingly representable.
meanings.sent4: His determination was as representable as a shining beacon.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of nature was representable in the stunning photograph.

meanings.definition: Deserving or capable of being a representative.
meanings.sent1: The wise old owl was a representable figure of knowledge.
meanings.sent2: The leader's speech was a representable example of unity.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy puppy was oddly representable as the class mascot.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was representable of the community spirit.
meanings.sent5: The hero's actions were representable of true courage.
